reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel on the basis of reviews, location and the fact it has a garage. The reviews turned out to be broadly accurate, and the garage was easy to park in (not always the case in old towns). The location was good in the sense it was within the city walls and reasonably close to most things, but to get to most places is a steep walk up hill.
reviews.title: Good location except uphill to almost everywhere

likes.disliked: — The steep uphill walk to almost everywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room and got about what we expected from this class of hotel - in particular it had very efficient air conditioning and the bathroom was large and modern (although the positioning of some things was odd - going to the loo one almost sat on the hand towels and it was impossible to get loo roll without pulling it off its holder). We had none of the noise problems mentioned in some reviews, indeed the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!

likes.liked: — Great room, best bed of our entire trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nowhere to sit in the hotel other than one's room (only one chair) or a small area in reception (but the hotel was being refurbished in part so that may change). The breakfast was standard "continental", but on our first morning the rolls had run out when we arrived at about 9.45 (we saw nothing to say what time breakfast was available) and not replaced - the only bread available was some sliced white which was sweet.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We THOUGHT we had booked a double room on the internet at 60 euro. When we arrived to check in we found we had not properly confirmed the reservation (our fault). Our desired room type was not available, and the staff was very helpful, offering to find us other accomodations. We decided to stay there and upgrade to a beautiful room (#209), even though it cost us double what we had expected. Our room was thoroughly updated and very quiet. Staff was very helpful with excellent food recommendations. Their breakfast buffet was certainly adequate and fairly priced. Parking was right next door for 12 euro a day. Overall, a clean, well run facility.
reviews.title: The Jewel of Toledo

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious rooms at a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After booking this hotel, I had read quite a few unfavorable reviews on various websites. The hotel is clean, the service is excellent and the breakfast more than adequate. And around the corner is one of the best restaurants, in my opinion, in Toledo.
reviews.title: Pick Another Hotel

likes.disliked: — Everything about it, except the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the hotel because of the traditional-and-modern hint and was not disappointed. The room was very nice, with excellent bathroom, caring for all the necessities, and the receptionist was also very helpful.
reviews.title: Good, but some minuses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, there were some not so pleasant things as well. The first - as usual in Spain - was the noise, both from street and from the neighboring bathrooms. The other thing was that our window was located the same level as the small square and stairs in front of the hotel, so, basically, if we kept the window open, anyone could look in. Though the windows are barred, have curtains and shutters, keeping them closed made quite hot and dark in the room.
reviews.title: Great choice for Toledo getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled on business
reviews.text: But anyway I liked this hotel very much.
reviews.title: The old capital of Spain and where to stay
More bad than good
reviews.text: In such a compact city as Toledo, we thought this hotel was great. It was easy to access ( as Toledo could be quite challenging if you decide to drive through it) and the best part was that it did had its own parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is not a 5 star hotel, however for a 3 -4 star we did not mind. Yes, you will not have a pool, 3 restaurants and a spa, however it is clean, staff is helpfull and it has its own charm. The rooms are average, maybe a little outdated, however matching the architecture of the hotel. We found it comfortable and pretty.
reviews.title: Great choice for seeing the old town

likes.disliked: — motor noise from outside our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I could not be more happier with my room at El Greco Sercotel. My room is spacious, my balcony is fabulous, the bath is a jacuzzi, the towel rack is heated... My internet works just fine as I sit here and sip wine looking out my balcony doors.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very centrally located in the Jewish quarter and within walking distance to all attractions. The room is not particularly large, adn there was a cupboard that almost did not allow access to one side of the bed, but bathroom is nice and all is clean. We did not take the breakfast.We also found the desk staff somewhat aloof - they checked us in and out but not overly friendly. Parking is a problem - we ended up parking in the street and paying for coupons rather than the price wanted by the hotel.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: There's a fantastic hotel in a very nice place. It' placed in the Jewish quarter.
reviews.title: Excellent
Great choice
reviews.text: In general the hotel is nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are two rooms in the ground floor near the reception desk that are quite noisy.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for Toledo expeditions!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Indeed, this is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are unique, spacious, comfortable and rich-looking with all the amenties you need and the price was very fair! The views out the window were unreal.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in beautiful but very unfriendly city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant where breakfast is served is beautiful and breakfast was quite good; lots of choices, well presented. Also, the location of the hotel is perfect. But frankly, as long as you're staying inside the city, there's no bad location.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with lots of charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In fact, it's such a tiny city we actually tried to split up from the couple we were traveling with and then ended up running into them 3 times before we gave up and had dinner together at a delicious restaurant just a stone's throw up from the hotel (See my glowing review of La Orza).
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also, if you arrive early or leave late (before/after check in), they will let you store all your luggage in a large closet off the lobby that they keep locked. This was VERY convenient and much appreciated.
reviews.title: A good hotel in a nice part of the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's the downside that permeated our trip to Toledo: Like almost everyone we encountered in the city, the concierges were disturbingly unfriendly - no eye contact, no smiling, no welcome, no warmth. They were consistenly cold, short, infinitely annoyed by your presence and expressed ZERO appreciation for our business.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is in a convenient location to walk to most sites in Toledo. Hotel staff are knowledgeable and helpful and rooms are comfortable with good beds and bedding and nicely decorated. Rooms feature beautiful hand crafted wood doors, trim and furniture. Upon arrival I was treated to marzipan, it was invented in Toledo! An optional breakfast is served in the hotel each day and is very good. From the hotel all sights are up hill, good exercise. There is a bus, but I did not take it. Toledo has winding narrow streets, so some attractions are difficult to find. Great experience, would stay here again. I upgraded to a bigger room and was quite pleased with the extra space and larger bed.
reviews.title: Perfect small hotel, good location, good service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for only one night, but were quite pleased. Even though it's located in a 17th century building, the rooms are contemporary with all the trappings of a 3-star hotel (although our bathroom was pretty small), The staff was generally friendly, and the continental breakfast was fine. It's obviously very popular, so generally fully booked. If you're driving, there is a dedicated garage right next door. However, like most of the hotels in the crowded old quarter of Toledo, it's very difficult to find and you might find yourself driving aimlessly through the very narrow streets (like we did). I would strongly recommend coming in from the west (Puerta de Cambron) which puts you right on Calle de los Reyes Catolicos which you can follow all the way around to the hotel which is just past the Jewish Synagogue Museum as the street makes a hard left turn. Also, be aware that there is a lot of very steep walking in the old quarter.
reviews.title: Overall, A Good Choice in Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: We stayed here just f just one night, although it was the least interesting aspect of our stay in an otherwise exceptional city. I regretted staying here only one night- in toledo. If you like extraordinary views and long walks, this is a great oasis between city stays also, it was so nice towander the streets AFTER the throngs of students and tourists had gone back to Madrid. This is a place to linger/walk/eat/photograph/breathe in. There was nothing wrong with this average to good hotel ( I didn't eat here but my mom said the 9euro breakfast buffet was great), but when I return I will definitely seek a place in town (parador is too far) with more atmosphere and charm to lend to this romantic city. PS as others, I think, have written, they have THIN walls. In our case it bothered me during the day (room 223) when I wanted to nap and I could here every word and movement of housekeeping and guests, but was lucky that at night all was still and quiet.
reviews.title: Very nice overall, though not especially memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Pintor El Greco on April 2-3. The reviews on this site are absolutely accurate. The hotel location is excellent, nestled in the heart of the Jewish section of Toledo and a ten minute walk from the Cathedral and the plaza mayor. Unlike so many other hotels in Spain, there is a convenient drive to pull your car up to and the private garage is literally directly across the street from the hotel (14 euro per day). From the exterior, the building appears to be a small, quaint European hotel. When you step inside, however, the hotel is a perfect blend of old world charm and modern styling. The elevator is comparable in size to most American hotel elevators and easily accommodates two guests and all of their luggage. The room is also very large (we booked a Superior Room). The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate. The only criticism that we had was the air conditioning ventilation. We stayed in room 102 and the vent for the air conditioning is on the wall, close to the ceiling alongside of the bed. My wife stayed on the side of the bed closer to the wall and had no problem. The air from the vent blows over the person closer to the wall and falls in what could only be described as "gusts" on the person sleeping on the side of the bed away from the wall. This was, however, a small inconvenience when considering the great location, beautiful hotel and room and excellent staff. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I enjoyed my two-night stay, finding the staff always helpful and pleasant. My regret was not to take up the option for a premium room, as I found myself located below street level, even though I was on the floor above the lobby area (due to the hilly topography of Toledo). I therefore missed my daylight. Soundproofing was also poor, as I discovered when the energetic couple next door returned con mucho amor. Nevertheless, I would willingly return and recommend - it is a most attractive establishment.
reviews.title: Two notes of caution

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights during Corpus Christi celebrations in June 2009. My husband had stayed here two years ago and suggested we return. The hotel is in an historic building but is part of the Sercotel chain, and that means it works harder at customer service since it must meet national standards for the chain. In my opinion, they succeed. This is almost a three-star hotel, but the rates are two star, meaning great value for the money. The location is ideal for visiting historic central Toledo around the cathedral. The hotel is one block from the astounding city walls and two blocks from the El Transito Synagogue and the beautiful high-gothic San Juan Church. Staff very professional and speak excellent English, free internet access at computer in lobby. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Only problems we had were difficulty in getting in and out of the parking garage, and a very poor choice of restaurants near the hotel (avoid the place around the corner -- it's awful). I also suggest you ask for a room away from the elevator to get the best sleep as the passenger traffic on stairs and elevator can be heard in room. Overall, this was a very good choice, and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Best hotel in our entire trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel sufficient--the room and bathroom were clean, large, quiet. The décor, in our room at least, was not charming as some of the pictures had indicated. There is a garage adjacent to the hotel but they did charge us 13 Euros. We could not find any restaurants or bars around the area that stayed open past 8. The hotel was inexpensive and did allow smoking but it was the least memorable of any of our stays.
reviews.title: Sufficient but not memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Pintor El Greco definitely exceeded my expectations. A little challenging to find, as all our hotels have been. Within Walking distance of everything we wanted to see in Toledo. Large room, large bathroom. We had a superior room with Breakfast included for 90ish Euros. I felt it was a good value and a great room.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff very helpful. Room clean. They were all set up for three of us sharing the room including extra robes and towels. The breakfast was very filling, plenty of choices. They had an underground parking facility across the small street. A lot of people complain about the uphill walking. They must all be couch potatoes. The walking is easy and everything is withing 15 minutes.
reviews.title: A very pleasant and servicable hotel from which to explore the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having lived in Madrid 10 years ago, we always took day trips to Toledo. During this trip we wanted to stay in the city and this hotel was the perfect choice. Finding the hotel was a bit tricky since we took a wrong turn and had to navigate through some very narrow streets (sometimes backwards!). Overall it was a fun adventure for my 3 teenagers. The hotel staff was friendly the rooms were clean and quiet. My husband & I stayed in a room just off the lobby; it only had a small window that looked into the courtyard, but that didn't bother us. Our children's room was on the 3 floor and could only be reached by the stairs. It was very large (even with all 3 beds) and had a window to the outside; it was very nice. We were able to walk to everything and enjoyed the shopping and eating that was only steps away from the hotel. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on that service.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely hotel is located right next to the El Greco museum and a 15 minute walk from the main square, but there's plenty to see and do nearby. It's dangerously close to the delicious mazapan by Santo Tome. We stayed in one of the newer rooms on the far side of the hotel. The entire place far exceeded my expectations. The room was large (by European standards), clean and nicely decorated. The staff at the hotel was incredibly friendly and offered some great restaurant suggestions. One of the best places to eat in Toledo is right around the corner. I've already recommended the place to numerous people.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been renovated beautifully. Rooms a bit needy of cheering up. No access to English speaking channels.breakfast is bland .the best thing about this hotel is the location.based in the old Jewish area of toledo.could reach all areas on foot.
reviews.title: Excellent location.hotel more like a three star than a four star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming hotel and a great location! Our room had all of the amenities of a modern hotel, but exuded old world charm. We were nervous about the car parking situation, but had absolutely no problem with getting a space in their garage. The breakfast was nice and we had a wonderful couple of days walking around Toledo exploring. Loved it!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last August during one of those typical Spanish heat waves. We paid only 55 euro for a night. As we have understood, the hotel used to be a 3 starts hotel but was upgraded recently to a 4 stars hotel. We got a room on the ground floor, which meant that we could not open the windows without people looking right inside our room even if there were soms plants strategically placed. Luckely we could open the upper part of the windows for some light. We were welcomed with a bottle of wine, so we decided not the complain (intelligent hotel management, I would say). The room is very basic and not too big, but nice and new.The bathroom was looking new as well AND.... there was a very nice new bubble bath, heavenly!!! The location is very good, next to the Jewish Quarter and a short walk to the rest of the city. Easy reachable by car and paying parking available (about 15 euro a day) but public parking available close by. Breakfast buffet not included but was very good (10 euro I think). Staff was friendly, somebody helping to carry your suitcases to the room and the car. Good value for money! Would definitely return but then not in the room on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price we paid, especially because of the bubble bath!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel on the night of 8th October. We booked a superior room. The plus points
reviews.title: A really good hotel that could be exceptional if they sort the car parking out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel. Very good and convenient location. If you have a car this hotel is easy to to get in and out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: From this hotel it was just a short walk to many of Toledo's sights and restaurants. It was also across the street from one of the best restaurants we ate at on our trip. Be prepared for some hilly streets though, Toledo has them.
reviews.title: Good location, Charming rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The design of the room was quite good and fit with the mystique of Toledo quite well. The free wifi was also nice.
reviews.title: Small and modern but charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well-located with shops and restaurants nearby and a 10-min walk to the Cathedral & other sights. Our room was clean, spacious, and modern, but still had charming decor. The double bed (two twin beds pushed together) was very comfortable. Large bathroom with great tub/shower, nice toiletries, thick towels. Flat screen tv (with BBC for those wanting to catch up on world news in English). Complimentary pieces of mazapan were delicious and a welcoming touch. Computer with free internet in the lobby. Hotel overall was tidy and very quiet (we slept well). Staff was cordial and helpful with a map and directions. We had to check out at 6:30 am the next day to catch a train, so we missed breakfast which didn’t start until 7:15. We’d hoped they could arrange for us to get some rolls, yogurt, or even just coffee before we left, but they were somewhat inflexible which was disappointing. Other than that, we had a great stay. We normally stay at hostales or pensiones for €75 or less, so Pintor El Greco was a bit of a splurge for us, but we found it to be a good value.
reviews.title: Looking brand new, but still in perfect harmony with Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: The hotel is located in the inside border of the historic center.
reviews.title: Charming, Quiet, Quaint Gem of a Hotel in the Heart of Historic Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here some 6 years ago and I was reasonably confident in recommending it to a group of of 9 friends - of which I was one. Fortunately, all were more than pleased with my choice and agreed that it was good value.
reviews.title: ¡Buenos recuerdos!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Within the "Casco Historico" but with some space around it, the hotel is convenient for most of the major sites of Toledo. The property is historic but has been modernised tastefully and well. The rooms are all of a reasonable size and are furnished and equipped to a good standard. Staff and service were friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Romantic, rustic gem
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: As to reasons for withholding a top rating, it is worth noting that he lounge area is somewhat limited and it is a shame that - other than the excellent breakfast - there is no food service; though a cellar bar provides a relaxed setting for a late night drink..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thoughtfully restored with loads of character, this hotel in the old Jewish quarter of Toledo is apparently a former bakery with exposed beams and brickwork. Rooms seem to be in small clusters dotted around the building. Ours was spotless, reasonably sized with a small terracotta roof terrace, bath with shower and reasonable wifi reception. There's a large comfortable lounge with bar but this is only manned from 19.30 to midnight and didn't restock the Carlos I brandy when it ran out after one round on our first of three nights' stay. There's also an outdoor area for smokers but the hotel is otherwise no smoking. Reception staff were polite and helpful and a most comprehensive hot and cold buffet breakfast with fresh fruit was served daily. Most of Toledo old town is on a hill accessed through tiny winding cobbled streets necessitating a bus or taxi to the hotel though there is limited parking adjacent. Toledo is compact enough to explore on foot though I can recommend the tourist double-decker bus trip from Plaza de Zocodover -a 15 minute stroll from the hotel- which gives a fantastic view of the city walls from the other side of the river.
reviews.title: Small and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: When we arrived from the station the hotel looked even better than we had hoped, inside was just as nice. We checked in, the receptionist was really nice even when I was attempting to check in speaking Spanish, we were given our key and told how to get to our room which was a smoking room which we had requested. This is where it goes downhill slightly we were given a triple room all singles, room very narrow but long, no windows, bathroom very small considering it was a triple, bath was also a jacuzzi and a shower over the bath but not enough room to swing a cat, there was no tea or coffee making facilitates and only two electrical sockets which 1 was in the bathroom there was a mini bar but really you needed a mortgage to drink out of it so avoid if you can. This hotel is advertised as a 4 star hotel yes it looks good and has some nice touches like the jacuzzi but no one to show you to your room, no literature about the hotel and no tea and coffee facilitates in my book lets what could and should be a great hotel down after all that we would definetly recommend it and would stay there again, great location as well but let down by some obviously daft lack of foresight
reviews.title: Many good reviews but disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three nights at this hotel in April, 2006. The staff was friendly and helpful, they have a parking garage which is a big plus I understand in Toledo as parking on the street is not suggested and difficult, its in a good location within the old city near museums and the temple and has a nice authentic exterior. My dissapointment with the hotel was the room itself and the hallways although we had a balcony and a nice view of the street, be it a little noisy, but you are in a city. The floor was awful, warn out 70's tile, and the bed was the quality you might expect in a youth hostel. The furniture was extremely basic, the quality you might put in a childrens playroom because you know it will get ruined. I'm not sure how they got a three star rating, I would down grade it to a two. If your looking for a good value within the city, choose this hotel, if you want something nice, look further.
reviews.title: Good Value But Below Standard Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: Desk staff not very friendly - in fact women at the desk gave us wrong info regarding the bus and told us to go to two local restraunts that turned out to be closed that night. Room #10 wassmall and outdated but the worst was the NOISE! Everytime someone flushed the tolet or ran the shower it was like they were right there in our room. Could not sleep with all the noise.
reviews.title: Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: After a group traveling three weeks in Spain we went to this hotel with great expectations. It was the most expensive hotel in our trip, but we were looking for location and this hotel is well located. But, the staff was not friendly, the room was in a basement. My room was not noisy but one of the couples traveling with us had a nightmare because the noise in the early morning.
reviews.title: deception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: I would not stay in this hotel again. As a matter of fact I saw a small hotel Posada de Manolo and for me, it has much better location, the staff was very friendly and the price was a bargain.
reviews.title: Hotel with a lot of charm and good accomodation
Great hotel !
reviews.text: The hotel is on the far SW side of town easily reached by a taxi from the train station or bus station. It is just a short (up only one short hill) and fascinating walk to the Cathedral and just a little farther to the center of town Plaza Zocodover. Thus the hotel was convenient and in a quiet section of town. The rooms are histroic/rustic but nicely furnished with a great bed, wonderfully modern and clean bathroom. We loved the radiant under floor heat (especially in the bath) but we couldn't find a way to regulate the heat except by opening the window. If we returned to Toledo we would definately stay at this fine hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a cab from the train station to our hotel. It was in a great spot. The hotel was small and very charming! The bathroom was tiny but our room was a good size. Our windows opened to the outside central common area (wonderful Toledo air!). Located in Old Toledo and within walking distance to all the major attractions!
reviews.title: Charming and Conveniently Located!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and are glad that it was only one night. The double room we had was absolutely nothing like the pictures on the interet, the furnishings were tatty and old, the curtains were filthy, the bathroom was tired and dated with dirty grouting. The water from the hot water tap was yellow, we complained about this and were told that the whole towns water supply is like this. Strange then that the cold water was OK, suggests to me it was the boiler. The room was very noisy, the walls very thin, someone had a dog in a room that barked late into the night. The room was too warm with underfloor heating, but the aircon unit was too noisy to use, we could even hear next door´s unit. Breakfast was very expensive for what it was, there wasn´t even any hot milk for coffee. This hotel is definitely lacking in a lot of areas for a four star hotel, and I would not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: The only good thing about this hotel is the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Our room in the new wing was very clean, quiet and comfortable if a bit too 'oblong' with a bit of a sqeeze to walk past the end of the bed. Good bathroom (shower but no tub). There was a comfy sofa at the end of the bedroom but not lit to allow easy reading after dark. Good breakfast with a lot of choice in a very attractive room.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is beautiful with many thoughtful design elements of stone and wood. Very quiet neighborhood, short uphill walk into city. Nice continental breakfast in delightful breakfast room. No tubs, beds rather stiff, otherwise great, very modern room with small sitting area. Computer available in lobby. Desk staff fluent in English though not very helpful with directions in a very confusing city. Eat across the street at la Luz - excellent.
reviews.title: Beautiful design and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was located in an ideal position for exploring the old city, with plenty of bars and restaurants within short walking distance. Toledo is a really small city so even Alcazar, which is across town, was more accessible than I'd anticipated from reading other reviews. The hotel itself looked recently decorated or refurbished as everything was spotlessly clean and new looking.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The windows wouldn't open but this was a minor inconvenience as the air conditioning was very effective (and we visited in February when temperatures are low anyway).
reviews.title: In one word: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — The whole experience of being welcome!
likes.disliked: — Maybe a small minor point, the airco in our room didnt work. But at reception they were more then willing to help!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: Because I am living in Madrid, I was looking for a nice place to go to but not having to travel the whole day. And since Toledo is only 45 minutes by bus, I thought that would be a nice option.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I always check this site as it tells you the stories of the people who have been there, instead of only nice words and pictures from the hotel itself.
reviews.title: We found a treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say, Toledo is not very big, which mean that from the hotel to the big attractions would mean 15 minutes walking (in normal paste). So the location is good. In front of the hotel there is a little parc where you have a nice view on the river.
reviews.title: Wonderful accomodations

likes.liked: — spacious room that fit in with the atmosphere of Toledo
